snippet: The United States and Russia have joined forces to draft a resolution, hinting at the possibility of greater cooperation to end Syria’s civil war.
abstract: United States and Russia cooperate on United Nations resolution strengthening sanctions on countries doing business with terrorist groups; agreement signals two countries' willingness to prioritize defeat of Islamic State, while deferring contentious decision on fate of Syrian president Bashar al-Assad.
lead_paragraph: The United States and Russia have joined forces to draft a resolution, hinting at the possibility of greater cooperation to end Syria’s civil war.

headline.main: U.N. Council to Adopt Sanctions Against ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.N. Council to Adopt Sanctions Against ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
